rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative adjective directly modifying a risk-adjective.
The segment uses factual language ('have been documented', 'has been reported'), lacking high-potency framing.
Contains scale (numbers) but no moderate verb describing impact.
Segment does not contain a loaded rhetorical question.
Reports absence of cases (bare positive fact) but lacks explicit calming language.
'only one' has a minimiser but lacks explicit scale contrast.
'No human cases have been documented' is a bare negation without an explicit calming cue.
